intro: Schaueria calycotricha, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in a dense, velvety pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green, followed by berries that turn red when mature. Schaueria calycotricha thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in disturbed soils. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes.
